intro: Microcoelia bieleri, commonly known as the Bieler's microcoelia, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences. The plant has finely divided leaves and produces tiny, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in early spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires careful conservation efforts. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
